column5: Thumbs up on NICE SPOT!!![email protected] I send my best friends to this spot... Mista W
Check out Duck Bay lodge on LOTW out of Morson. www.duckbaylodge.com
Thank you for all of the suggestions. I am checking each of them out. The nice thing about starting my search this early is I have time to look. If anyone has other suggestions please let me know.

http://www.chukunirivercampground.com/ Might be a bit rustic, but if your camping they have elect and water outlets, also some RV's that they rent. Red lake is a great place to go as the lake is nothing but structure and the owners can point ya towards spots that are hitting. Another big plus is the camp is on the river, which makes life much easier when the winds are up and your docking or loading, plus you can catch a lot of walleyes or northerns on the river when the weather is foul. Also other lakes can be gotten to by boat from there. Al
Which part of Canada are you interested in going to?
Back in June, Rexman started a threat titled "Drive in with outpost". There were several lodges listed that would probably suit your needs. Good luck - Stu

Sounds like Cherob Resort is the place you want to check out. Rob plays the bagpipes as well as Soprano,Alto,Tenor and Base Recorder. He also sketchs trees,stumps and things. He and his wife have three cabins.
e-mail me at [email protected] I can probably help you on a place to stay Randy
e-mail me at [email protected] I can probably help you on a place to stay Randy

Next year my wife would like to go north with me agine. She really isnt into a lot of fishing but she does like to go out a few times each trip. She really loves Canada and likes to spend alot of her time there sitting outside reading, drawing, painting, playing her flute and exploring. We do not want to go to a large camp and a fly in is out. If any of you have suggestions for a cabin or small camp please let me know. Thanks Charlie
Check www.bignorthlodge.com we have been going there for a few years now and just love it.Very small,private,relaxing and great fishing.
Also try Onaway Lodge on Lac Seul. 888-662-9291

Try Sanctuary Resort, it is on an island on Whitefish Bay, in Lake of the Woods, only 3 cabins, either American Plan or Housekeeping been in business over 50 years and is operated by the Horley family(807-226-5632) winter/(807-226-1216) summer. World class musky fishing, good pike, bass, and lake trout fishing, there are also limited opportunites for walleye. BOB
Thank You, I am checking these out. Any one else have suggestions?
You could try Wine Lake Camp but the only down fall is it is a 25 mile boat in camp. You can look at it on www.winelakecamp.com. Scott

I haven't gone to any of the following resorts but I am considering them: www.routelakelodge.com This resort is north of Dryden, housekeeping or American Plan and you can do Housekeeping and arrange for some meal(s) on the American Plan. I believe it is a short boat in, the only lodge on the lake. Also: www.wenasaga.com This housekeeping resort is a few miles north of Ear Falls. I believe this is a drive in housekeeping resort and is the only one on the lake. I like boat in lodges because the fishing is generally better than the drive to but is not as costly as flyin fishing. However for a nonfisherperson, a drive to resort allows for a drive to town, etc. Good luck
Check out Amik Lodge located on Rainy Lake's Northwest Arm. There are only 3 very nice cabins. Feel free to send me PM with any questions.http://www.amiklodge.com/ :cheers:

http://www.cottageads.com/index.php?page=out&id=387 Nice location, new docks, place is perfect for 2 people. Close to town and great fishing, even off the dock. Nicely set up. Pine all thru the place. Has a million dollar view... And private...Well priced also... Nice Spot
